stringToDate

public static final java.util.Date stringToDate(java.lang.String value,
                                                java.lang.String format)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Accepts a date as a String and converts it to java.util.Date. The date will be converted based on the date format passed as "format". If format is null, then "value" is assumed to be in the format of "yyyy-MM-dd".

Parameters:
value - String value to convert
format - Date Format
Returns:
java.util.Date
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if "format" is not an acceptable java date format

                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Accepts a date as a String and converts it to java.util.Date. The format of, "value", is expected to match one of the date formats in the ArrayList, "dateFormats".

Parameters:
value - String value to convert
Returns:
java.util.Date
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if a date format match is not found.

stringToNumber

public static final java.lang.Number stringToNumber(java.lang.String _value,
                                                    java.lang.String _format)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
Accepts a number as a String and converts it to the java wrapper class, Number. The number will be converted based on the numeric format passed as "_format". If _format is null, then "_value" is assumed to be in a form acceptable for parsing and converting _value without _format.

Parameters:
_value - String value to convert
_format - Number Format
Returns:
Number
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if "format" is not an acceptable java numeric format

Parameters:
value - The number for convert.
format - The format to apply to the conversion.
Returns:
The String representation of value.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If format is invalid or an unacceptable date format.

java.lang.Exception - If _format is invalid or an unacceptable date format.

getTokens

public static final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTokens(java.lang.String _str,
                                                               java.lang.String _delim)
Parses _str by extracting embedded values separted by character values that equal _delim. Each value extracted will be packaged in a ArrayList which is returned to the caller.

Parameters:
_str - String that is to parsed for tokens
_delim - The delimiter separates the tokens
Returns:
List of each value extracted from _str or null if _str was unable to be parsed.

splitLongSku

public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> splitLongSku(java.lang.String sku)
Splits a sku value in th upper and lower parts.

The lower half should be the lowest 8 digits. The upper half should be the everything greater than the lowers 8 digits. For example, if the sku value is "11122223333", then the upper half would be "1111" and the lower half would be "22223333". If the sku is 8 digits or less then the upper half will equal "0".

Parameters:
sku - a String representing the value of the sku
Returns:
a Map containing the results of the split. Map's keys will equal "lower" and "upper". The mapped values will contain Integer types.

createColorInstance

public static final java.awt.Color createColorInstance(java.lang.String colors,
                                                       java.awt.Color defColor)
Creates an instance of Color from a list of RGB values containted in colors.

Parameters:
colors - a String representing the RGB numeric values that will comprise the color. The list of values should occur in the order of red, green, and blue and separated by commas.
defColor - an instance of Color representing the default color assinged in the event an error occurs or if colors is found to be invalid.
Returns:
an instance of Color based on the values containted in colors or the default known as defColor.

verifyFile

public static int verifyFile(java.lang.String _pathName)
Verifies that _pathname is a valid Directory or File.

Parameters:
_pathName - The file path.
Returns:
1=File Exist, -1=File does not exsit, -2=File inaccessible, and 0= Argument is an empty String or null.
